div.p: Greetings. I return the booklet (reverend father in Christ) that you sent to be read, and indeed I owe you thanks. I also send some news from the council chamber, which, if you do not yet have, I hope will not be unwelcome to you. But you should return all these things through a trusted person; for they belong to the lord orator, who shares these with us.
Besides this, I have nothing new.
Farewell, reverend father in Christ, with all your family, as happily as possible.
All of ours wish you well.
I am expecting letters from lord Heinrich, your son, whose long silence I wonder at. Farewell again.

I ask you, reverend father, to ensure these letters are delivered to lord Pellicanus - he is mentioned in them -, and also to the widow of Leo, his relative, in which there is a thaler; therefore, I would like them to be delivered with care. As for the business of Quadrius, I hope divine mercy will provide for us.

Certainly, many good men, whose minds we have explored, will vigorously oppose; but also the papists contradict this new institution; and our people will not do much to favor Ferdinand. You will hear other reasons.
To the most illustrious man, excellent in learning and piety, lord Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant Antistes of the Church of ZÃ¼rich, his lord and much esteemed patron.
